title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 113.26 - Duties of secretary of city board
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 113.26 - Duties of secretary of city board

State Regulations

The secretary of the city board shall act as the clerk of
the appeal board. His duties in this regard shall include, but not be limited
to: (a) receiving and keeping separate
all appeal papers, orders, applications and other papers filed in or otherwise
relating to each appeal; (b) immediately transmitting a copy of each order other than a proposed order of a
panel or final order filed by the appeal board to each party to an appeal or
his counsel; (c) making copies of
all appeal papers, orders, applications and other papers filed in an appeal
available (1) for examination by the public during normal business hours; (2)
for purchase by the public at a reasonable price not to exceed the cost or
reproduction; and
(d) transmitting
a copy of the final order and any memoranda filed by the city board in
conjunction therewith to the parties or their counsel and to any person or
organization who has participated in the appeal as amicus curiae. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
113.26

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
